p: The results of this test reported in Figure 4 indicated that coriander, parsley, and celery extracts were demonstrated considerable ( p < 0.001) discrepancies regarding the reduction of MDA formed by the oxidative action of FeSO 4. Parsley exhibited the highest antioxidant power (IC 50 = 32.19 µg/mL) followed by celery and, then, coriander (IC 50 = 58.04 µg/mL). These findings are largely higher compared to ascorbic acid (IC 50 = 98.25 µg/mL) being the reference antioxidant.
